Computer Graphics Programming Assignment
  • Question Twenty Three
  • View page source

Question Twenty Three

Write a program that draws three black dots of radius 0.25 at x = 0, 1, 2 along the x-axis. Then display instead three black dots at positions t, t + 1, and t + 2 (using t = 0. 25 initially). Make the display toggle back and forth between the two sets of dots, once every quarter-second. Do you tend to see the dots as moving? What if you increase t to 0. 5? Include a slider that lets you adjust t from 0 to 3. Does the illusion of the dots moving ever weaken? When t = 1, you could interpret the motion as “the outer dot jumps back and forth from the far left (x = 0) to the far right (x = 3) while the middle two dots remain fixed.” Can you persuade yourself that this is what you’re seeing? The strong impression that the dots are moving as a group is remarkably hard to abandon, supporting the Gestalt theory.

OpenGLWidget Class

class OpenGLWidget

It is a custom QOpenGLWidget for rendering dynamic dots.

Variables:

  • t – Current time for dot animation.

  • timer – QTimer for periodic updates.

__init__(parent=None)

Constructor for the OpenGLWidget class.

Parameters:

parent – The parent widget.

initializeGL()

OpenGL initialization method.

resizeGL(w, h)

Resize event handler for OpenGL.

Parameters:

  • w – New width of the widget.

  • h – New height of the widget.

paintGL()

Paint event handler for OpenGL.

drawDot(x, y, radius, color)

Draw a dot on the OpenGL canvas.

Parameters:

  • x – X-coordinate of the center of the dot.

  • y – Y-coordinate of the center of the dot.

  • radius – Radius of the dot.

  • color – RGBA color values of the dot.

updateDots()

Update the position of the dots.

MainWindow Class

class MainWindow

It is the main window for the application.

Variables:

  • centralWidget – The central widget of the main window.

  • layout – QVBoxLayout for arranging widgets.

  • openglWidget – Instance of OpenGLWidget for rendering dots.

  • slider – QSlider for controlling dot animation.

__init__()

Constructor for the MainWindow class.

updateT(value)

Update the value of ‘t’ based on the slider position.

Parameters:

value – Slider position.

showMaximized()

Show the window maximized.

main()

Main function to demonstrate the MainWindow class.

Inherits from: QMainWindow
